    Generate Automated Reports from CFSTRenD Objects

    generate_report.Rd

    Creates HTML reports from various CFSTRenD analysis objects using predefined R Markdown templates. The function automatically selects the appropriate template based on the input object's class and renders a comprehensive report with visualizations and analysis results.

    generate_report(
  robj,
  data_report.reports_sel = c(1, 2, 3, 4),
  output_file = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    robj

    An R object containing analysis results from CFSTRenD functions. The object's class determines which report template is used. Supported classes depend on available templates in the package.

    data_report.reports_sel

    Numeric vector. Specifies which report sections to include in the output. Default is c(1,2,3,4) to include all sections. The meaning of each number depends on the specific template being used.

    output_file

    Character string. Optional path and filename for the output HTML file. If NULL (default), the report is generated with an automatic filename and opened in RStudio viewer.

    ...

    Additional parameters passed to the R Markdown template. Available parameters vary by template type and are filtered to only include those recognized by the selected template.

    Value

    Character string. The file path of the generated HTML report. As a side effect, if output_file is NULL, opens the report in RStudio viewer.

    Details

    The function works through the following process:

    • Determines the object class and selects corresponding template

    • Validates that a template exists for the given object type

    • Merges user-provided parameters with base parameters

    • Filters parameters to only those accepted by the template

    • Renders the R Markdown template with the specified parameters

    • Opens the result in RStudio viewer (if no output file specified)

    Note

    This function requires that appropriate R Markdown templates exist in the package's inst/rmd/ directory. Templates must be named following the convention template_[type].Rmd where [type] corresponds to the object class or template identifier returned by get_template_and_params().

    Template System

    The function uses a template system where:

    • Templates are stored in inst/rmd/ directory

    • Template selection is based on get_template_and_params()

    • Each template has defined parameters it accepts

    • Template files follow naming convention: template_[type].Rmd

    Report Sections

    The data_report.reports_sel parameter controls which sections appear in the final report. Section numbers and their meanings are template-specific. Common patterns include:

    • 1: Summary statistics and data overview

    • 2: Main analysis results and visualizations

    • 3: Detailed breakdowns or secondary analyses

    • 4: Appendices or supplementary information

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Generate default report for a CFSTRenD analysis object
my_results <- some_cfstrend_function(data)
generate_report.a(my_results)

# Generate report with specific sections only
generate_report.a(my_results, data_report.reports_sel = c(1, 3))

# Save report to specific file with custom parameters
generate_report.a(my_results,
                  data_report.reports_sel = c(1, 2, 4),
                  output_file = "my_analysis_report.html",
                  custom_title = "Forest Analysis Results",
                  include_maps = TRUE)

# Generate report with additional template parameters
generate_report.a(my_results,
                  output_file = "detailed_report.html",
                  animation_fps = 2.0,
                  color_scheme = "viridis")
} # }
